meanings.definition: To remove the trim or decoration from something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to untrim the Christmas tree to create a simpler look.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to untrim the excess fabric to make the dress fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: After the party, they untrimmed the balloons, leaving the room bare.
meanings.sent4: The gardener untrimmed the bushes, revealing the natural beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent5: He carefully untrimmed the edges of the paper to achieve a clean finish.

meanings.definition: Not trimmed or neat in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The untrim edges of the carpet gave it a rugged look.
meanings.sent2: Her untrim hair flowed freely in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The untrim garden had a wild and untamed charm.
meanings.sent4: The untrim jacket added a casual touch to his outfit.
meanings.sent5: The untrim bookshelves were filled with books of all sizes and shapes.

meanings.definition: To make less neat or tidy.
meanings.sent1: The wind untrimmed her neatly arranged hair.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally untrimmed the neatly folded laundry pile.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy untrimmed the neatly pruned bushes.
meanings.sent4: The rain untrimmed the carefully arranged flower bed.
meanings.sent5: The children untrimmed the tidy room in search of their lost toy.
